utterance.speaker: FREEDMAN
utterance.content: Sorry to keep you waiting, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Not a problem, sir. You’re a busy man.

utterance.speaker: FREEDMAN
utterance.content: Tell that to the Attorney General. He just had his first grandchild and he wants to show me pictures. So, Agent Stack spoke very highly of you. Smart, tenacious, innovative thinker. Said you were a good candidate for the opening on the AG investigative team.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I appreciate his confidence, sir.

utterance.speaker: FREEDMAN
utterance.content: You don’t agree?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, sir, it’s that – - well, I’m a homicide detective. I don’t have any federal experience.

utterance.speaker: FREEDMAN
utterance.content: The Attorney General’s not looking for federal experience. He wants people that can get the job done. And from everything I’ve read, that might be you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s very kind of you, sir.

utterance.speaker: FREEDMAN
utterance.content: It’s not kind. It’s what you believe to be true, isn’t it? It’s why you got on the plane this morning, because given your background, your qualifications, and your track record, you know that you’re headed for bigger things. Just like you know that opportunities like this come along once, maybe twice in a lifetime. But, if that’s not what you believe, if you think you’re just a homicide cop – – door’s right over there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No sir. I know why I’m here.

utterance.speaker: FREEDMAN
utterance.content: Well, take a seat. Let’s get started.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad, we need to talk.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Which of these do you like better?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I’m serious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I like the green one, but it kind of looks like a giant green lizard’s attacking the city. Which is cool, but it’s not what the book’s about, so I either rewrite the book to make it about a giant lizard, or –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Magenta. You’re right. It’s classic. It’s cool. It tells the story –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Professor Rankowski still hasn’t received the check for my Costa Rica trip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He didn’t? That’s so weird.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You didn’t send it, did you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why – why do you want to go study the rainforest for six weeks anyway?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, we talked about this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. But you’re going to be staying in the middle of a jungle, miles away from the nearest phone, hours from the nearest hospital. You could be bitten by a poisonous spider, or a poisonous snake. I looked it up. Toucans are extremely aggressive this time of year.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Is this about Paris?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I will admit to being slightly overprotective in light of recent events.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I can’t stop living my life because of what happened. And yeah, I still have nightmares. But that’s one of the reasons I want to go. I don’t want to let fear win.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, of course. You’re right. I’ll – I’ll write the check. But it’s not going to stop me from worrying about you. Or missing you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I wouldn’t want you to. But it’s only six weeks. It’s not like I’m going away forever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But it sounds like someone has.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey there. Nice to see you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey ‘sito.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How the hell should I know? Aren’t you two practically living together now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, well, she left me alone for a couple of days so I could finish Deadly Heat, which, by the way, is both deadly and hot, thank you very much for asking.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Sorry I’m late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um… yeah. Fine. So, what’ve we got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This way.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: The Cedric’s a pretty typical, no star, residential hotel. Mostly transients and foreign tourists that don’t know any better. Guests started complaining of a strange colored water and also a foul odor coming from the pipes this morning. Maintenance finally checked it out and they found her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Hey. So we’ve got a Caucasian female, probably 20, 21 years old.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’d she die?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not sure yet. There’s evidence of blunt force trauma to the head but I won’t know cause until I get her back to the morgue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: CSU found traces of blood and hair on that ventilation fan. They’re running it for a match.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So someone smashed her on the head and dumped her in the tank?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like it. They found blood on the base of that ladder and on the hand railing. And also a bloody partial print.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who else had access to the roof?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Pretty much anyone. The latch on the door’s been busted for years and often the residents will sneak up here for a smoke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what do we know about her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Building manager identified her as a resident named Crystal Sky. Checked in ten days ago into a room on the 18th floor. Paid in cash.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Crystal Sky? That name’s so fake it sounds like something out of one of your books.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? Whoa, whoa. What is that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean, what is that supposed to mean? Derrick Storm? Nikki Heat? Jameson Rook? Would it kill you to name someone Gonzalez every once in a while?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, with no ID found on the body, no purse, wallet or phone in the room, it’s hard to know who she is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she’s been here for ten days. She must have made some friends.

utterance.speaker: ZIFF FALGRAD
utterance.content: Yeah, I knew her. We talked sometimes in the laundry room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she tell you anything about herself? Like where she was from?

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: Texas. Lubbock, I think. You know, things were bad at home, her dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea what she was doing in the city?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Oh, I can tell you what she was doing. The girl was a prostitute.

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: She wasn’t a prostitute. Why you gotta say that?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Because it’s true! The way she dressed, the sounds coming out of her room at all hours of the night. We all knew it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of sounds?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN TILLAGE
utterance.content: Her with her johns. Walls here are pretty thin.

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: Hey, you don’t know what you’re talking about, okay?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Ziff, I know you liked her. But somebody killed that poor girl. These folks need to know the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time any of you folks saw her?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: I saw her yesterday around 11PM. She was heading toward the laundry room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was anybody with her?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: She was alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. CSU just finished their sweep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they find anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s what they didn’t find. There were no prints. It’s like the place has been wiped down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The killer must have come back to the room to get rid of the evidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, set up a canvass. See if anyone else entered or exited that room. And uh, let’s pull footage from the security cam in the elevator. Maybe it’ll tell us who she was with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It doesn’t take a best-selling mystery writer to figure this one out. Small town girl with big city dreams ends up turning tricks to survive. It’s a tragic, yet all too familiar tale.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Except that’s not this girl’s story. We just got a fingerprint off the victim’s body. Uh, her name’s not Crystal Sky and she’s definitely not from Lubbock, Texas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, who is she?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Erika Albrook. She’s an honors student at Harvard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our skid row hooker’s a Harvard honors student?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like I said, a tragic, yet not so familiar tale.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Same day she checked into that hotel. Any idea what she’d be doing in the city?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were there any personal issues we should know about? Did she have any problems with – – drugs or money?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it possible she met someone in the city? A new boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure about that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Straight A student, no history of trouble, on a dream European vacation, turns into a hooker in a ratty hotel. There is no way I’m letting Alexis go to Costa Rica now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe she broke under the pressure of being perfect. Or maybe she just decided she needed a change.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Honors student to prostitute in less than a week? That’s quite a change.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it doesn’t make any sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, where were you this morning?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just called you. Bunch of times.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … my phone must have been off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey guys. Come check this out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: 11PM the night Erika died. She takes the elevator down to the laundry room. Now this is 11:05. She takes the elevator back up to her room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seems perfectly normal.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but watch. This is just after midnight. She takes the elevator up to the top floor alone. But watch what happens when she gets there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like she’s making sure no one sees her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or following her. But that’s it. She doesn’t come back down. And no one goes back up there until 4AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about earlier?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nope. The last person to go up to the top floor was another hotel guest an hour earlier. But the guy’s 80 years old. There’s no way he’s climbing a water tower with a body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like whoever killed her used the stairs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So, no recent activity on her phone. She left it with her parents since she was supposed to be in Europe. But um … check this out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Credit card charge?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. From two days ago. It’s her only transaction since checking into the hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Margo’s. It’s a restaurant in Midtown. It’s expensive.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And she wasn’t alone. Turns out she spilt the check with a Talia McTeague.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Run her down. Maybe she can give us some answers. Hey, is there anything on the canvass?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing useful. None of the occupants of the hotel admit to seeing anyone going in and out of her hotel room, but given what they heard coming from her room at night it’s pretty clear she was a prostitute.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: If she was a prostitute, she wasn’t very good at it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? You can tell that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Prostitution usually means sex and there’s no evidence of sexual activity. But what I did find were defensive wounds, bruising around the neck, and evidence of multiple blows to the head. I’m guessing someone held her by her throat and slammed her head into that ventilation fan. Lack of water in the lungs indicate that she was dead before she went into the tank.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why even bother putting her in there?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Water has a great way of washing away things like trace DNA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, I don’t understand. If she wasn’t having sex then what were all of those sounds coming out of her room?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so she wasn’t really a hooker, she just wanted everyone to think that she was. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but not everyone thought she was a hooker. That guy next door? He was pretty adamant that she wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what did he know that the others didn’t?

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: I already told you guys what I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not everything, Ziff. How did you know she wasn’t a prostitute?

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: Look, please, I don’t want any trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you murder her?

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: What? No!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then nothing you say is going to get you into trouble.

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: Well, I heard those … sounds, you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Ziff.

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: There’s a hole. In the wall. In the back of the closet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were spying on her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you see?

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: Well, that’s the thing. I heard all those sounds, but there was nothing going on. It was just her sitting on the bed all night, fully dressed, with her headphones on, typing on her laptop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There wasn’t a laptop in the room.

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: There used to be. She’d be up all night staring at the screen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you ever seen anyone else in there with her?

utterance.speaker: ZIFF
utterance.content: No. It was always just her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks for coming in, Miss McTeague.

utterance.speaker: TALIA MCTEAGUE
utterance.content: Of course. I can’t belive she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, how did you know Erika?

utterance.speaker: TALIA
utterance.content: We were friends from Harvard. We were both computer science majors.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you know what she was doing in the city?

utterance.speaker: TALIA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But you had lunch with her two days ago. Why?

utterance.speaker: TALIA
utterance.content: It was weird. That morning I was getting coffee from this place in the Village, and I saw her in this big argument with some guy. She was dressed very different, sexed up and her hair was pink. Anyway, he storms up and I go up to her to say hello and she just looks at me with this panicked look on her face and bolts. Later that day she tracked me down, called me at my office, and said we needed to meet up right away.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what happened at lunch?

utterance.speaker: TALIA
utterance.content: She begged me not to tell anyone that she was in the city. That if people found out she could be in a lot of trouble.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did she say why?

utterance.speaker: TALIA
utterance.content: I kept asking her what was going on. She said she was on some sort of a mission.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A mission?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy that she was arguing with. Do you know who he was or what they were arguing about?

utterance.speaker: TALIA
utterance.content: No. I just heard him say ‘you have no idea what you’re up against. These people don’t mess around.’

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: TALIA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uniforms are canvassing the Cedric but so far nobody recognizes him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s what I don’t get. Why go through all the trouble of creating a fake persona when you’re just going to be on your laptop all night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. Does the Cedric have wi-fi?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s about all it has.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Computer science major? Hours on her laptop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s a hacker. Which is why she was staying at the Cedric. She could pay in cash, remain anonymous while she was using the IP address.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. And whatever she was hacking into was either so illegal or so dangerous she had to make sure they couldn’t trace it back to her. And even if they did trace it back to her, they’d still have to find her amongst hundreds of residents.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she created a false persona. And who’s going to look twice at a runaway hooker? I mean, she’s like the girl with the dragon tattoo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only they did find her, which is why we can’t find her laptop. Whoever she went up against killed her and took it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, problem. We don’t know who she went up against and none of her friends seem to know either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Contact the Cedric’s internet provider and get a list of the IP addresses accessed by residents over the past two weeks. There’s gotta be an answer somewhere in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about I take a break from writing tonight? You come to my place, I open a bottle of wine.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? Can I have a word?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. I’ll catch you later?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s all yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Shut the door.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Have a seat.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I uh … just got a call about you? From the Deputy Director of the FBI. Apparently you had quite the interview in DC. This morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, sir, it was –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I just want to tell you that … I gave you my highest recommendation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You did?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Kate, this is the kind of work you were meant to be doing. You’d be on the national stage utilizing all your talents. This is an incredible opportunity. I would have killed to have a shot at something like this when I was your age.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir, but it was just an interview. It’s a long shot at best.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, I wouldn’t be so sure about that. From what I hear, you’re on a short list. And with any luck, this could be your last case.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Girl, you scared me. What are you doing here so early?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just wanted to see if you had anything new on the victim.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, I was able to place time of death between 12 midnight and 1AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh, and I found traces of creosote under her fingernails, which is probably meaningless since the boiler room is right next to the laundry room and it could have gotten on her hands when she went down there.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: But … that’s not why you’re here, is it? Okay. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing. Yet. Lanie, if you had the opportunity to do something that you wanted to do but it would mean that … everything in your life might change. Would you take it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, it depends. How good is the opportunity?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Really, really great. But the job’s in DC.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: But you’re worried about Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, we’re in this relationship but … we never talk about where we’re going. And that’s okay, for now. It’s just – what if I get that job?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Then you’re going to have to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe that’s not such a bad thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but what if it is? Hey, Castle. Yeah, no. I just wanted to get an early start on the day. I didn’t want to wake you up. Okay, all right. I’ll meet you there.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: So I ran down all the IP addresses that were accessed through the hotel’s server to find out what our victim was up to.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any luck?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: The majority of the IPs were to porn sites.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Which ones?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I took the liberty of ruling those out, as well as commercial sites: Google, Amazon, YouTube. That narrowed it down to a couple hundred sites.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we’re still looking for a needle in a haystack.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Not necessarily. I took those and went back and looked for multiple unique site hits that coincided with the dates your victim was checked into the hotel. That left about 20.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ooh. Now we’re talking, girl. I can deal with 20.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: You might not have to. Of those 20, I looked for IPs that were accessed late at night during the period when your witness claimed your victim was on her laptop. This is your most likely candidate. The server IP was accessed multiple times a night nearly every night Erika was at the hotel.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And who’s it belong to?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The IP was traced to Banks and Bauer. It’s a boutique law firm in Midtown represents high level politicos and corporations.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Erika was some kind of an online Erin Brockovich. You know, a crusader for good delving into the seedy underbelly of the legal system to uncover some seedy truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe she was just hired by a rival firm to steal privileged information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now why must you be so cynical?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s in my job description.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is why you need me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, why don’t you dig into Erika’s life? Castle and I will hit the law firm, see if there’s any connection.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you?

utterance.speaker: JESSICA BANKS
utterance.content: No, I’ve never seen her before in my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Banks, you’re sure?

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: Oh, I’m positive. Mitch! He’s my partner, Mitch Bauer. Do you know this girl?

utterance.speaker: MITCH BAUER
utterance.content: No. Should I?

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: Well, police think she might have hacked our server.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Why? What’d she access?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Well, is she in custody?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sort of.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: What do you mean, sort of?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, she was murdered and we believe it might have to do with whatever she was trying to access from your system.

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: Security software and firewall protection don’t indicate any incursion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but if the hacker’s good your software might not pick it up. Is there any way to track network activity on your server for the past week?

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There. Between 11PM and 3AM all last week.

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: But according to the usage logs, no one was signed onto the system at that time.

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: Are you telling me this girl had access to our records for the last week and a half and you have no idea what she was doing?

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: I’m afraid so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are there any cases or litigation that your firm’s involved in currently that might hinge on privileged information?

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: Are you kidding me, Detective? We’re a law firm. All of them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So no one at the law firm knew what she was looking for either?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Either that, or they’re covering something up. But the only evidence of what she was up to is on that missing laptop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So without it we’re dead in the water. Much like Erika.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Too soon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. I got something. That phone call that she made to her friend to arrange lunch had me wondering where exactly that call came from. Turns out, it was a pay phone from the hotel, so I ran down the other calls made from that phone. One of them popped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ian Blaylock?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. He was an attorney at Banks and Bauer until he was fired six months ago. She made three phone calls to him from that phone, each lasting over five minutes. This is Blaylock.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Blaylock! NYPD! Mr. Blaylock! Open up!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think our plot just thickened.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m pretty sure this wasn’t a suicide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How can you tell?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: See that diagonal ligature mark running up his neck?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, that’s what we expect to find because the weight of the body pulls the cord into a vertical line.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: But this other faint ligature mark, see how it runs horizontally across his neck?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was strangled first.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Then strung up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we have a second murder.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, technically it’s the first murder. Given temperature and decomposition, I’d say he died a day before our lady in the water tank.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I was going through Blaylock’s recent activity. I found this chat exchange between him and an anonymous user.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘Changed my mind, can’t live like this anymore. Will tell you everything I know. Where can we meet?’

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The person replies, ‘There’s a place near where I’m staying. Cedric Hotel. Rooftop. At midnight.’

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She asked him to meet her up there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She must have thought it was a location she could control.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, guys? Look at what time he sent the message.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: 10PM the night she was murdered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right, but according to Lanie’s time of death, Blaylock was already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this was sent by whoever killed him. He lured her out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And killed her too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the folks at the law firm claim that they have no idea why anyone would murder Blaylock or why Erika was looking for him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did they at least tell you why they let Blaylock go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only that it was a personal issue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It must have been pretty serious. We checked with friends. Apparently he was a rising star at the firm, until about a year ago when out of the blue he became distant and withdrawn. Marriage fell apart and he started doing drugs. It’s like something happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Erika was looking into the firm. Blaylock used to work at the firm. And now they’re both dead. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Just heard back from Erika’s parents. The law firm rang a bell. Turns out that Erika’s best friend from high school interned there last summer. A Pam Bonner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Maybe she can give us some answers. Where do we find her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, Mount Hope Cemetery in Westchester. She was killed last summer in a car crash.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What were the circumstances?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, there were no witnesses but according to the police report she was driving home from the firm’s summer party. She lost control, crashed into a tree. Autopsy indicates she was intoxicated at the time, but Erika never believed the official account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any reason why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, she believed that Pam would never drive drunk. And when they found Pam she was wearing high heels and Erika said she never drove in heels.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Three deaths, all leading back to the law firm of Banks and Bauer. Is it just me, or is this starting to smell like a John Grisham novel? A single car accident with no witnesses? Guys, this is a classic conspiracy cover up. Though only a lowly intern, Pam stumbles on to something the firm is doing, something big. Nefarious. She has to be silenced, only after the accident Blaylock can’t take the guilt. Or admit the truth. So his only bastion is to escape the sweet oblivion of drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then when Erika starts coming around they realize that they’re going to have to act by eliminating them both. But what are they covering up?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whatever it is, the only possible evidence is on Erika’s laptop, which our killer took.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Wait, are we sure about that? Erika was meeting Blaylock on the roof, right? A guy, according to the emails, she didn’t know very well. If I’m Erika I’m hiding that laptop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we searched her room. It wasn’t in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, do you guys remember the footage from the elevator?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. She went down to the laundry room first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Lanie said she found traces of creosote under her fingernails from the boiler room next door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: The laptop’s in the basement.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man. This was Castle’s theory. How did we draw the short straw?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. Let me ask you something. You notice anything weird about Beckett?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, she’s - she’s different. Something’s off.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you saying? Like she’s pregnant?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you talking about? Where did that even come from?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you said she was acting different. They’re consenting adults –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett is not pregnant. C’mon, man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s so wrong with being pregnant?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know, I can’t even talk to you about this right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. Well, um … try to get over it before Jenny tells you the news, okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? Are you serious? Wow, congratulations, man. That’s great!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks, bro.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hold up. There’s something up here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s a laptop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that’s great. Thank you. So they found the laptop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I knew it. So what was on it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the hard drive is encrypted so techs are going through it now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, somewhere on that computer is a conspiracy of lies so heinous, so deadly –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boarding pass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you fly to DC yesterday?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was invited down for an interview.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of interview?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For a position. With the Federal Task Force.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, you interviewed for another job in another city … and you didn’t tell me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t tell you about it because it was just an interview and I knew you would be upset.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … yeah. Yeah. You’re damn right I’m upset.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I just wanted to see what was out there. What’s wrong with that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s wrong with it is that you hid it from me. In fact, you lied about it. I wouldn’t do that to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, this isn’t about you. This is about me. This is about my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re seriously considering this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes! This is a wonderful opportunity. It’ll be a chance to do more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Without me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, please don’t do this. Don’t make this about us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, tell me how this isn’t about us. You get this job, you move to DC, I’ll never see you. That’s pretty much the end of our relationship, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t know that. And I probably won’t even get the job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not the point. The point is, you knew what this could mean. And it didn’t occur to you to include me. Or worse, it did occur to you. And you chose not to. Now what does that say about us? Not much, you ask me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t be here right now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’s Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We had a fight, okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like a regular fight, or –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How bad?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. We got something.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Once your victim hacked into the law firm, she started with the basics – emails, calendars, payroll. Then she moved on to client and personal files.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do we know what she was looking for?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hard to say. But for the last few nights Erika became very focused on the firm’s accounting department.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The accounting department?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It appears that she was looking into Ian Blaylock’s billable hours records.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Focusing exclusively on one week last summer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. That’s the same week as Pamela Bonner’s car accident.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right. Now, check it out. The highway patrol determined that Pam Bonner’s accident occurred between 1:30 and 2AM. And Ian Blaylock billed for an incoming phone call from a client at 1:45AM.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you think one of his clients might have been involved. Maybe ran her off the road.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to the highway patrol it was a one car accident.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, what if Erika was right? What if Pamela wasn’t driving drunk or in her high heels? In fact, what if Pamela wasn’t driving at all?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Someone else was driving. Someone who crashed and didn’t want to be blamed for Pam’s death, so he put her behind the wheel, fled the scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then called their lawyer. Who made that phone call to Blaylock?

utterance.speaker: TORI
utterance.content: For security the firm replaces its clients names with codes. This one’s 47BGO.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, the firm’s never going to give up that information. Let’s see where else that code shows up. Cross reference it. See if we can identify it from there.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: You don’t have to look too far. Blaylock billed that very same client for a round of golf the day after the car crash.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, that would be a perfect place to discuss details. No one would overhear them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So according to the starter at the pro shop, Blaylock was playing golf with another member, a Colin Rigsdale III.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Of the Rigsdale political family?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Word is Daddy’s grooming him for a state senate run.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not if this gets out. A fatal car crash with a college chick? No, he’d be done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why he was covering it up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: With Blaylock’s help – ‘til the guilt set in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then Erika started poking around and people started dying.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It says here Rigsdale is still represented by Banks and Bauer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Give them a call. Tell them I’m coming.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. What’s going on? Where’s Castle?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t ask.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for meeting with me, Mr. Rigsdale.

utterance.speaker: COLIN RIGSDALE III
utterance.content: Well, when Jessica told me someone hacked into their system I was of course concerned. I think we all know what my political opponents might do if they managed to access confidential information.

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: So the girl who hacked into our system, did you find out what she was after?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. And we also believe we know why she was killed. Are you familiar with a girl named Pamela Bonner?

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: Detective, what is this about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Rigsdale?

utterance.speaker: RIGSDALE
utterance.content: Name’s not familiar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? I understand that she was an intern here at the firm last year, isn’t that correct? And isn’t it also correct that you attended the Banks and Bauer summer associate party last year?

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: Don’t answer that. Detective, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The same thing that my victim, Erika Albrook, was doing. Trying to figure out how her best friend, Pamela Bonner, actually died.

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: Her death was an accident.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Then why do we have a record of Ian Blaylock, Mr. Rigsdale’s attorney at the time, receiving a phone call from him at 1:45 that night?

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: Detective, this is privileged information. It’s inadmissible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we’re not in court.

utterance.speaker: BANKS
utterance.content: This meeting is over. You need to leave. Now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just tell me. How am I supposed to trust her? How am I even supposed to – to be in a relationship with her if she won’t let me in?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Well, Richard –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After everything that we’ve been through together, I – I just don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I hate to say it, kiddo, but I do. Look, the truth is, Katherine is a bright, ambitious woman. She should be interviewing for that job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whose side are you on?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You want her to put you first when neither one of you knows where the relationship is going. Do you know how absurd that is? I mean, that is as bad as your not signing that check for Alexis’s program.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This isn’t about me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Are you sure? I know you. You do not hold back. Except this thing with Katherine. It took you what, three years to tell her how you felt, another year to act on it, and now, at the first sign of trouble, you’re ready to run. Why? Now, you’re having a good time. You both are and I know you say you love her, but darling, this is who she is. So is it possible that the reason you have held back is because, somewhere deep down inside, you don’t think this is going to really work?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I take it he didn’t confess?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t need him to. I just needed to see his eyes. It’s him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, the evidence begs to differ. His fingerprints are in the system from a political protest a decade ago. I ran them against the partial. It’s not a match. And the papers put him at his family’s compound in Maine during Erika’s murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, he’d never do this himself. And hiring someone else is too risky for a public figure. He’d - he’d get a close associate or a trusted friend to do it, so why don’t we dig into his life, find out who.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: FREEDMAN
utterance.content: Detective. Deputy Director Anthony Freedman calling. Do you remember? From the interview.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yes, sir. Yes, I do. What can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: FREEDMAN
utterance.content: You can say yes. Detective, you got the job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Where’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She took off about an hour ago. Something’s going on but she wouldn’t tell me what.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. Well, I was looking into Rigsdale’s known associates. I came across this photo. That is Martin Tillage, Rigsdale’s half-brother and the black sheep of the family. Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we interviewed this guy. He was one of the guests at the Cedric.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He must have checked in to try to find her and hung around so his departure didn’t look suspicious. He’s gotta be our guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll have uniforms pick him up. See if you can find Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JIM BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like a great offer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it is.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Your mom would be proud. Hell, I’m proud.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: So… what are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Dad. It’s like I’m standing at a crossroads and I have to choose between two possible futures.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: What do you think you have to choose?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because Dad, he’s right. If I take this job, then there’s not going to be time for anyone else, and then if I don’t –

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: It’ll be because of him and you’ll end up resenting him for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or – – worse. Dad, I don’t know what we have. I don’t know if it’s real. It’s like we’ve been doing this dance for the past five years and … I mean, what happens when the music stops? That if all we were in love with was the dance?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: You know, your whole life you’ve never had a relationship go this far. You know, right around here you always end them. Now why is that? Look, Katie, I know you. When you get scared you hide in your work. And I just want to be sure whatever decision you make, it’s because it’s what you want. Not because you’re afraid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This job. It’s what I want.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Then tell him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s gonna hate me, Dad.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: That’s something you’re going to have to live with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My last case. I better go end it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There you are. I’m sorry it took me so long to write it. Go have fun.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks, Dad.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You seem sad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s only Costa Rica. I’ll be back before you know it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that’s sweet. But no, it’s not about that. It’s uh – something your grandmother told me. There comes a point in our lives when we have to stop fooling ourselves into thinking life’s going to be the way we want it to be and start seeing things for how they really are.

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: So I was there. So what? I needed a place to stay for a couple of nights. Is that a crime?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but killing a girl is. What did you brother promise you, Martin? Respectability for the black sheep, a place at the family table –

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: I told you. I’ve never seen this girl before in my life. You’re wasting your time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any idea how many people have sat across that table and confessed their sins to me? What makes you think that you’re any different? Any smarter? You’ve only been in this room for one hour. But this room – - this room has been my life. My home. And I will not let you sit there and lie to me in my own home. This is a partial print found at the crime scene in the victim’s blood. It’s a match to yours, Martin. Am I still wasting my time?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got enough to convict you. So the question is, how many years of your own life are you going to sacrifice for someone else’s future? Or are you ready to deal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
